1028  //============================================================================
1029  // Method Description:
1041  template<typename dtype>
1042  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
1043  {
1044  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
1045  {
1046  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1047  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1048  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1049  }
1050 
1051  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1052  {
1053  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1054  {
1055  return false;
1056  }
1057  }
1058 
1059  return true;
1060  }

1144  //============================================================================
1145  // Method Description:
1158  template<typename dtype>
1159  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1160  {
1161  switch (inAxis)
1162  {
1163  case Axis::NONE:
1164  {
1165  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1166  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1167  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1168 
1169  return std::move(returnArray);
1170  }
1171  case Axis::ROW:
1172  {
1173  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1174  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1175  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1176  {
1177  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1178  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1179  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1180  }
1181 
1182  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1183  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1184  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1185 
1186  return std::move(returnArray);
1187  }
1188  case Axis::COL:
1189  {
1190  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1191  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1192  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1193  {
1194  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1195  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1196  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1197  }
1198 
1199  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1200  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1201  {
1202  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1203  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1204  }
1205 
1206  return std::move(returnArray);
1207  }
1208  default:
1209  {
1210  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1211  // of the compiler warning.
1212  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1213  }
1214  }
1215  }
1216 
1217  //============================================================================
1218  // Method Description:
1237  template<typename dtype>
1238  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1239  {
1240  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1241  {
1242  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1243  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1244  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1245  }
1246 
1247  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1248  {
1249  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1250  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1251  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1252  }
1253 
1254  std::vector<dtype> values;
1255 
1256  dtype theValue = inStart;
1257 
1258  if (inStep > 0)
1259  {
1260  while (theValue < inStop)
1261  {
1262  values.push_back(theValue);
1263  theValue += inStep;
1264  }
1265  }
1266  else
1267  {
1268  while (theValue > inStop)
1269  {
1270  values.push_back(theValue);
1271  theValue += inStep;
1272  }
1273  }
1274 
1275  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1276  }
1277 
1278  //============================================================================
1279  // Method Description:
1297  template<typename dtype>
1298  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1299  {
1300  if (inStop <= 0)
1301  {
1302  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1303  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1304  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1305  }
1306 
1307  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1308  }
1309

1333  }

1504  //============================================================================
1505  // Method Description:

1826  //============================================================================
1827  // Method Description:
1838  template<typename dtype>
1839  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1840  {
1841  switch (inAxis)
1842  {
1843  case Axis::NONE:
1844  {
1845  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1846  {
1847  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1848  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1849  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1850  }
1851 
1852  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1853  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(),
1854  weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1855 
1856  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1857  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1858 
1859  return std::move(returnArray);
1860  }
1861  case Axis::COL:
1862  {
1863  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1864  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1865  {
1866  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1867  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1868  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1869  }
1870 
1871  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1872  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1873  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1874  {
1875  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1876  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(),
1877  weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1878 
1879  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1880  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1881  }
1882 
1883  return std::move(returnArray);
1884  }
1885  case Axis::ROW:
1886  {
1887  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1888  {
1889  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1890  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1891  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1892  }
1893 
1894  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1895 
1896  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1897  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1898  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1899  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1900  {
1901  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1902  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(),
1903  weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1904 
1905  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1906  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1907  }
1908 
1909  return std::move(returnArray);
1910  }
1911  default:
1912  {
1913  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1914  // of the compiler warning.
1915  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1916  }
1917  }
1918  }

1936  //============================================================================
1937  // Method Description:
1954  template<typename dtype>
1955  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1956  {
1957  // only works with integer input types
1958  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1959 
1960  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1961  if (maxValue < 0)
1962  {
1963  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1964  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1965  }
1966 
1967  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1968  {
1969  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1970  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1971  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1972  }
1973 
1974  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1975  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1976 
1977  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1978  outArray.zeros();
1979  for (auto value : clippedArray)
1980  {
1981  ++outArray[value];
1982  }
1983 
1984  return std::move(outArray);
1985  }
1986 
1987  //============================================================================
1988  // Method Description:
2008  template<typename dtype>
2009  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
2010  {
2011  // only works with integer input types
2012  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
2013 
2014  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
2015  {
2016  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
2017  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2018  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2019  }
2020 
2021  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
2022  if (maxValue < 0)
2023  {
2024  // no positive values so just return an empty array
2025  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2026  }
2027 
2028  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
2029  {
2030  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
2031  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2032  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2033  }
2034 
2035  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
2036  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
2037 
2038  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
2039  outArray.zeros();
2040  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2041  {
2042  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
2043  }
2044 
2045  return std::move(outArray);
2046  }

2240  //============================================================================
2241  // Method Description:
2251  template<typename dtype>
2252  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2253  {
2254  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2255  Shape finalShape;
2256  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2257  {
2258  if (finalShape.isnull())
2259  {
2260  finalShape = ndarray.shape();
2261  }
2262  else if (ndarray.shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2263  {
2264  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2265  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2266  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2267  }
2268  else
2269  {
2270  finalShape.cols += ndarray.shape().cols;
2271  }
2272  }
2273 
2274  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2275  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2276  uint32 colStart = 0;
2277  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2278  {
2279  Shape theShape = ndarray.shape();
2280  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2281  {
2282  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2283  {
2284  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = ndarray(row, col);
2285  }
2286  }
2287  colStart += theShape.cols;
2288  }
2289 
2290  return std::move(returnArray);
2291  }
2292 
2293  //============================================================================
2294  // Method Description:
2304  template<typename dtype>
2305  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2306  {
2307  switch (inAxis)
2308  {
2309  case Axis::NONE:
2310  {
2311  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2312  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2313  {
2314  finalSize += ndarray.size();
2315  }
2316 
2317  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2318  uint32 offset = 0;
2319  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
2320  {
2321  std::copy(ndarray.cbegin(), ndarray.cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2322  offset += ndarray.size();
2323  }
2324 
2325  return std::move(returnArray);
2326  }
2327  case Axis::ROW:
2328  {
2329  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2330  }
2331  case Axis::COL:
2332  {
2333  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2334  }
2335  default:
2336  {
2337  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2338  // of the compiler warning.
2339  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2340  }
2341  }
2342  }

2500  // Method Description:
2510  template<typename dtype>
2511  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2512  {
2513  switch (inAxis)
2514  {
2515  case Axis::NONE:
2516  {
2517  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.size() - static_cast<uint32>(std::count(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), static_cast<dtype>(0)))};
2518  return count;
2519  }
2520  case Axis::COL:
2521  {
2522  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2523 
2524  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
2525  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2526  {
2527  returnArray(0, row) = inShape.cols -
2528  static_cast<uint32>(std::count(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), static_cast<dtype>(0)));
2529  }
2530 
2531  return std::move(returnArray);
2532  }
2533  case Axis::ROW:
2534  {
2535  NdArray<dtype> inArrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
2536  Shape inShapeTransposed = inArrayTranspose.shape();
2537  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShapeTransposed.rows);
2538  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeTransposed.rows; ++row)
2539  {
2540  returnArray(0, row) = inShapeTransposed.cols -
2541  static_cast<uint32>(std::count(inArrayTranspose.cbegin(row), inArrayTranspose.cend(row), static_cast<dtype>(0)));
2542  }
2543 
2544  return std::move(returnArray);
2545  }
2546  default:
2547  {
2548  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2549  // of the compiler warning.
2550  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));
2551  }
2552  }
2553  }

2567  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2568  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2569  {
2570  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2571  {
2572  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2573  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2574  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2575  }
2576 
2577  switch (inAxis)
2578  {
2579  case Axis::NONE:
2580  {
2581  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2582  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2583  {
2584  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2585  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2586  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2587  }
2588 
2589  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2590  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2591 
2592  switch (arraySize)
2593  {
2594  case 2:
2595  {
2596  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2597  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2598  return std::move(returnArray);
2599  }
2600  case 3:
2601  {
2602  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2603  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2604  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2605  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2606  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2607  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2608 
2609  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2610  return std::move(returnArray);
2611  }
2612  default:
2613  {
2614  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2615  // of the compiler warning.
2616  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2617  }
2618  }
2619  }
2620  case Axis::ROW:
2621  {
2622  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2623  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2624  {
2625  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2626  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2627  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2628  }
2629 
2630  Shape returnArrayShape;
2631  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2632  {
2633  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2634  }
2635  else
2636  {
2637  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2638  }
2639 
2640  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2641  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2642  {
2643  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2644  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2645  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2646  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2647 
2648  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2649  }
2650 
2651  return std::move(returnArray);
2652  }
2653  case Axis::COL:
2654  {
2655  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2656  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2657  {
2658  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2659  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2660  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2661  }
2662 
2663  Shape returnArrayShape;
2664  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2665  {
2666  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2667  }
2668  else
2669  {
2670  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2671  }
2672 
2673  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2674  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2675  {
2676  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2677  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2678  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2679  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2680 
2681  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2682  }
2683 
2684  return std::move(returnArray);
2685  }
2686  default:
2687  {
2688  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2689  // of the compiler warning.
2690  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2691  }
2692  }
2693  }

2835  //============================================================================
2836  // Method Description:
2845  template<typename dtype>
2846  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2847  {
2848  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2849  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2850 
2851  switch (inAxis)
2852  {
2853  case Axis::NONE:
2854  {
2855  std::vector<dtype> values;
2856  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2857  {
2858  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2859  {
2860  continue;
2861  }
2862 
2863  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2864  }
2865 
2866  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2867  }
2868  case Axis::ROW:
2869  {
2870  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2871  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2872  {
2873  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2874  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2875  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2876  }
2877 
2878  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2879  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2880 
2881  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2882  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2883  {
2884  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2885  {
2886  continue;
2887  }
2888 
2889  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2890  {
2891  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2892  }
2893  ++rowCounter;
2894  }
2895 
2896  return std::move(returnArray);
2897  }
2898  case Axis::COL:
2899  {
2900  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2901  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2902  {
2903  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2904  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2905  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2906  }
2907 
2908  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2909  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2910 
2911  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2912  {
2913  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2914  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2915  {
2916  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2917  {
2918  continue;
2919  }
2920 
2921  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2922  }
2923  }
2924 
2925  return std::move(returnArray);
2926 
2927 
2928  }
2929  default:
2930  {
2931  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2932  // of the compiler warning.
2933  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2934  }
2935  }
2936  }
2937 
2938  //============================================================================
2939  // Method Description:
2948  template<typename dtype>
2949  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2950  {
2951  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2952 
2953  switch (inAxis)
2954  {
2955  case Axis::NONE:
2956  {
2957  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2958  break;
2959  }
2960  case Axis::ROW:
2961  {
2962  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2963  break;
2964  }
2965  case Axis::COL:
2966  {
2967  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2968  break;
2969  }
2970  }
2971 
2972  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2973  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2974  {
2975  indices.push_back(i);
2976  }
2977 
2978  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2979  }
2980

2991  template<typename dtype>
2992  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inIndex, Axis inAxis)
2993  {
2994  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2995  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));
2996  }

3040  //============================================================================
3041  // Method Description:
3052  template<typename dtype>
3053  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3054  {
3055  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
3056 
3057  switch (inAxis)
3058  {
3059  case Axis::NONE:
3060  {
3061  if (inArray.size() < 2)
3062  {
3063  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3064  }
3065 
3066  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
3067  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
3068  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3069 
3070  return std::move(returnArray);
3071  }
3072  case Axis::COL:
3073  {
3074  if (inShape.cols < 2)
3075  {
3076  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3077  }
3078 
3079  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
3080  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
3081  {
3082  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3083  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3084  }
3085 
3086  return std::move(returnArray);
3087  }
3088  case Axis::ROW:
3089  {
3090  if (inShape.rows < 2)
3091  {
3092  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3093  }
3094 
3095  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
3096  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
3097  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
3098  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
3099  {
3100  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3101  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3102  }
3103 
3104  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3105  }
3106  default:
3107  {
3108  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
3109  // of the compiler warning.
3110  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3111  }
3112  }
3113  }

3472  NdArray<dtype> eye(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inK)
3473  {

3475  returnArray.zeros();
3476 
3477  if (inK < 0)
3478  {
3479  uint32 col = 0;

3483  {
3484  break;

3494  {
3495  if (row >= inN)
3496  {
3497  break;
3498  }
3499 
3500  returnArray(row++, col) = 1;
3501  }
3502  }
3503 
3504  return std::move(returnArray);
3505  }

3631  template<typename dtype>
3632  NdArray<dtype> flip(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3633  {

3635  {
3636  case Axis::NONE:
3637  {
3638  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3639  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.end());
3640  return std::move(returnArray);
3641  }

3655  {

3660  default:
3661  {
3662  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3663  }

3949  //============================================================================
3950  // Method Description:
3962  template<typename dtype>
3963  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3964  {
3965  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3966  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3967  {
3968  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3969  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3970  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3971  }
3972 
3973  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3974  {
3975  // read in as binary file
3976  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3977  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3978  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3979 
3980  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3981  if (filePtr == NULL)
3982  {
3983  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3984  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3985  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3986  }
3987 
3988  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3989  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3990  fclose(filePtr);
3991 
3992  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
3993  delete[] fileBuffer;
3994 
3995  return std::move(returnArray);
3996  }
3997  else
3998  {
3999  // read in as txt file
4000  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
4001  {
4002  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
4003  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4004  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4005  }
4006 
4007  std::vector<dtype> values;
4008 
4009  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
4010  if (file.is_open())
4011  {
4012  while (!file.eof())
4013  {
4014  std::string line;
4015  std::getline(file, line);
4016 
4017  std::istringstream iss(line);
4018  try
4019  {
4020  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
4021  }
4022  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
4023  {
4024  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
4026  }
4027  }
4028  file.close();
4029  }
4030  else
4031  {
4032  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
4033  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4034  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4035  }
4036 
4037  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
4038  }
4039  }

4172  //============================================================================
4173  // Method Description:
4184  template<typename dtype>
4185  NdArray<double> gradient(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
4186  {
4187  switch (inAxis)
4188  {
4189  case Axis::ROW:
4190  {
4191  auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4192  if (inShape.rows < 2)
4193  {
4194  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 row.";
4195  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4196  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4197  }
4198 
4199  // first do the first and last rows
4200  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4201  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4202  {
4203  returnArray(0, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(0, col));
4204  returnArray(-1, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(-1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(-2, col));
4205  }
4206 
4207  // then rip through the rest of the array
4208  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4209  {
4210  for (uint32 row = 1; row < inShape.rows - 1; ++row)
4211  {
4212  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row + 1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row - 1, col))) / 2.0;
4213  }
4214  }
4215 
4216  return std::move(returnArray);
4217  }
4218  case Axis::COL:
4219  {
4220  auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4221  if (inShape.cols < 2)
4222  {
4223  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 columns.";
4224  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4225  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4226  }
4227 
4228  // first do the first and last columns
4229  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4230  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4231  {
4232  returnArray(row, 0) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 0));
4233  returnArray(row, -1) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -2));
4234  }
4235 
4236  // then rip through the rest of the array
4237  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4238  {
4239  for (uint32 col = 1; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
4240  {
4241  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col - 1))) / 2.0;
4242  }
4243  }
4244 
4245  return std::move(returnArray);
4246  }
4247  default:
4248  {
4249  // will return the gradient of the flattened array
4250  if (inArray.size() < 2)
4251  {
4252  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 element.";
4253  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4254  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4255  }
4256 
4257  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(1, inArray.size());
4258  returnArray[0] = static_cast<double>(inArray[1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[0]);
4259  returnArray[-1] = static_cast<double>(inArray[-1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[-2]);
4260 
4261  std::transform(inArray.cbegin() + 2, inArray.cend(), inArray.cbegin(), returnArray.begin() + 1,
4262  [](dtype value1, dtype value2) -> double { return (static_cast<double>(value1) - static_cast<double>(value2)) / 2.0; });
4263 
4264  return std::move(returnArray);
4265  }
4266  }
4267  }

4305  //============================================================================
4306  // Method Description:
4318  template<typename dtype>
4319  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4320  {
4321  if (inNumBins == 0)
4322  {
4323  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4324  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4325  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4326  }
4327 
4328  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4329 
4330  bool useEndPoint = true;
4331  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4332  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4333 
4334  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4335  {
4336  // binary search to find the bin idx
4337  bool keepSearching = true;
4338  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4339  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4340  while (keepSearching)
4341  {
4342  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4343  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4344  {
4345  // we found the bin
4346  ++histo[lowIdx];
4347  break;
4348  }
4349 
4350  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4351  {
4352  lowIdx = idx;
4353  }
4354  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4355  {
4356  highIdx = idx;
4357  }
4358  else
4359  {
4360  // we found the bin
4361  ++histo[idx];
4362  break;
4363  }
4364  }
4365  }
4366 
4367  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
4368  }

4485  //============================================================================
4486  // Method Description:
4503  template<typename dtype>
4504  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4505  {
4506  // do some error checking first
4507  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4508  {
4509  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4510  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4511  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4512  }
4513 
4514  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4515  {
4516  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4517  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4518  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4519  }
4520 
4521  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4522  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4523  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4524  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4525  uint32 counter = 0;
4526  for (auto sortedXpIdx : sortedXpIdxs)
4527  {
4528  sortedXp[counter] = inXp[sortedXpIdx];
4529  sortedFp[counter++] = inFp[sortedXpIdx];
4530  }
4531 
4532  // sort the input inX array
4533  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4534 
4535  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4536 
4537  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4538  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4539  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4540  {
4541  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4542  {
4543  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4544  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4545  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4546  }
4547  else
4548  {
4549  ++currXpIdx;
4550  }
4551  }
4552 
4553  return std::move(returnArray);
4554  }
4555 
4556  //============================================================================
4557  // Method Description:
4570  template<typename dtype>
4571  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4572  {
4573  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4574  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4575  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4576 
4577  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4578  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4579  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4580  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4581  }

4855  //============================================================================
4856  // Method Description:
4877  template<typename dtype>
4878  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4879  {
4880  if (inNum == 0)
4881  {
4882  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4883  }
4884  else if (inNum == 1)
4885  {
4886  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4887  return std::move(returnArray);
4888  }
4889 
4890  if (inStop <= inStart)
4891  {
4892  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4893  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4894  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4895  }
4896 
4897  if (endPoint)
4898  {
4899  if (inNum == 2)
4900  {
4901  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4902  return std::move(returnArray);
4903  }
4904  else
4905  {
4906  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4907  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4908  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4909 
4910  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4911  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4912  {
4913  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4914  }
4915 
4916  return std::move(returnArray);
4917  }
4918  }
4919  else
4920  {
4921  if (inNum == 2)
4922  {
4923  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4924  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4925  return std::move(returnArray);
4926  }
4927  else
4928  {
4929  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4930  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4931 
4932  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4933  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4934  {
4935  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4936  }
4937 
4938  return std::move(returnArray);
4939  }
4940  }
4941  }

5334  //============================================================================
5335  // Method Description:
5349  template<typename dtype>
5350  std::pair<NdArray<dtype>, NdArray<dtype> > meshgrid(const NdArray<dtype>& inICoords, const NdArray<dtype>& inJCoords)
5351  {
5352  uint32 numRows = inJCoords.size();
5353  uint32 numCols = inICoords.size();
5354  auto returnArrayI = NdArray<dtype>(numRows, numCols);
5355  auto returnArrayJ = NdArray<dtype>(numRows, numCols);
5356 
5357  // first the I array
5358  for (uint32 row = 0; row < numRows; ++row)
5359  {
5360  for (uint32 col = 0; col < numCols; ++col)
5361  {
5362  returnArrayI(row, col) = inICoords[col];
5363  }
5364  }
5365 
5366  // then the I array
5367  for (uint32 col = 0; col < numCols; ++col)
5368  {
5369  for (uint32 row = 0; row < numRows; ++row)
5370  {
5371  returnArrayJ(row, col) = inJCoords[row];
5372  }
5373  }
5374 
5375  return std::make_pair(returnArrayI, returnArrayJ);
5376  }

5610  //============================================================================
5611  // Method Description:
5622  template<typename dtype>
5623  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5624  {
5625  switch (inAxis)
5626  {
5627  case Axis::NONE:
5628  {
5629  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5630  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5631 
5632  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5633  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5634 
5635  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5636 
5637  return std::move(returnArray);
5638  }
5639  case Axis::COL:
5640  {
5641  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5642  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5643  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5644  {
5645  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5646  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5647 
5648  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5649  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5650 
5651  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5652  }
5653 
5654  return std::move(returnArray);
5655  }
5656  case Axis::ROW:
5657  {
5658  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5659  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5660  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5661  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5662  {
5663  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5664  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5665 
5666  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5667  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) -> dtype { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5668 
5669  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5670  }
5671 
5672  return std::move(returnArray);
5673  }
5674  default:
5675  {
5676  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5677  // of the compiler warning.
5678  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5679  }
5680  }
5681  }
5682 
5683  //============================================================================
5684  // Method Description:
5695  template<typename dtype>
5696  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5697  {
5698  switch (inAxis)
5699  {
5700  case Axis::NONE:
5701  {
5702  std::vector<dtype> values;
5703  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5704  {
5705  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5706  {
5707  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5708  }
5709  }
5710 
5711  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5712  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5713  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5714 
5715  return std::move(returnArray);
5716  }
5717  case Axis::COL:
5718  {
5719  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5720  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5721  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5722  {
5723  std::vector<dtype> values;
5724  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5725  {
5726  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5727  {
5728  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5729  }
5730  }
5731 
5732  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5733  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5734  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5735  }
5736 
5737  return std::move(returnArray);
5738  }
5739  case Axis::ROW:
5740  {
5741  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5742  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5743  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5744  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5745  {
5746  std::vector<dtype> values;
5747  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5748  {
5749  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5750  {
5751  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5752  }
5753  }
5754 
5755  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5756  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5757  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5758  }
5759 
5760  return std::move(returnArray);
5761  }
5762  default:
5763  {
5764  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5765  // of the compiler warning.
5766  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
5767  }
5768  }
5769  }

5772  // Method Description:
5783  template<typename dtype>
5784  NdArray<dtype> nanmin(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5785  {
5786  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5787  for (auto& value : arrayCopy)
5788  {
5789  if (std::isnan(value))
5790  {
5791  value = DtypeInfo<dtype>::max();
5792  }
5793  }
5794 
5795  return std::move(min(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5796  }

5798  //============================================================================
5799  // Method Description:
5811  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5812  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile,
5813  Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5814  {
5815  if (inPercentile < 0.0 || inPercentile > 100.0)
5816  {
5817  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5818  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5819  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5820  }
5821 
5822  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5823  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5824  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5825  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5826  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5827  {
5828  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5829  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5830  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5831  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5832  }
5833 
5834  switch (inAxis)
5835  {
5836  case Axis::NONE:
5837  {
5838  if (Utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 0.0))
5839  {
5840  for (auto value : inArray)
5841  {
5842  if (!isnan(value))
5843  {
5844  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(value) };
5845  return std::move(returnArray);
5846  }
5847  }
5848  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5849  }
5850  else if (Utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 100.0))
5851  {
5852  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5853  {
5854  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5855  {
5856  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5857  return std::move(returnArray);
5858  }
5859  }
5860  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5861  }
5862 
5863  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5864  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5865  for (auto value : inArray)
5866  {
5867  if (!isnan(value))
5868  {
5869  arrayCopy.push_back(value);
5870  ++numNonNan;
5871  }
5872  }
5873 
5874  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5875  {
5876  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5877  }
5878 
5879  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5880  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5881 
5882  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5883 
5884  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5885  {
5886  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5887  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5888  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5889 
5890  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5891  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5892  return std::move(returnArray);
5893  }
5894  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5895  {
5896  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5897  return std::move(returnArray);
5898  }
5899  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5900  {
5901  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5902  return std::move(returnArray);
5903  }
5904  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5905  {
5906  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5907  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5908  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5909  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5910  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5911 
5912  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5913  {
5914  case 0:
5915  {
5916  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5917  return std::move(returnArray);
5918  }
5919  case 1:
5920  {
5921  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5922  return std::move(returnArray);
5923  }
5924  }
5925  }
5926  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5927  {
5928  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5929  return std::move(returnArray);
5930  }
5931  }
5932  case Axis::COL:
5933  {
5934  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5935 
5936  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5937  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5938  {
5939  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5940  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5941 
5942  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5943  {
5944  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5945  }
5946  else
5947  {
5948  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5949  }
5950  }
5951 
5952  return std::move(returnArray);
5953  }
5954  case Axis::ROW:
5955  {
5956  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5957  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5958 
5959  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5960  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5961  {
5962  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5963  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5964 
5965  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5966  {
5967  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5968  }
5969  else
5970  {
5971  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5972  }
5973  }
5974 
5975  return std::move(returnArray);
5976  }
5977  default:
5978  {
5979  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5980  // of the compiler warning.
5981  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5982  }
5983  }
5984  }
5985

5987  // Method Description:
5998  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5999  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
6000  {
6001  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
6002  for (auto& value : arrayCopy)
6003  {
6004  if (std::isnan(value))
6005  {
6006  value = 1;
6007  }
6008  }
6009 
6010  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
6011  }

6078  //============================================================================
6079  // Method Description:
6090  template<typename dtype>
6091  NdArray<double> nanstdev(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
6092  {
6093  switch (inAxis)
6094  {
6095  case Axis::NONE:
6096  {
6097  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
6098  double sum = 0;
6099  double counter = 0;
6100  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
6101  {
6102  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
6103  {
6104  continue;
6105  }
6106 
6107  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
6108  ++counter;
6109  }
6110  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
6111  return std::move(returnArray);
6112  }
6113  case Axis::COL:
6114  {
6115  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6116  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6117  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6118  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6119  {
6120  double sum = 0;
6121  double counter = 0;
6122  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6123  {
6124  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
6125  {
6126  continue;
6127  }
6128 
6129  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6130  ++counter;
6131  }
6132  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6133  }
6134 
6135  return std::move(returnArray);
6136  }
6137  case Axis::ROW:
6138  {
6139  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6140  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
6141  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
6142  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6143  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6144  {
6145  double sum = 0;
6146  double counter = 0;
6147  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6148  {
6149  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
6150  {
6151  continue;
6152  }
6153 
6154  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6155  ++counter;
6156  }
6157  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6158  }
6159 
6160  return std::move(returnArray);
6161  }
6162  default:
6163  {
6164  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6165  // of the compiler warning.
6166  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
6167  }
6168  }
6169  }

6472  // Method Description:
6489  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6490  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile,
6491  Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6492  {
6493  if (inPercentile < 0.0 || inPercentile > 100.0)
6494  {
6495  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6496  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6497  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6498  }
6499 
6500  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6501  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6502  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6503  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6504  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6505  {
6506  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6507  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6508  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6509  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6510  }
6511 
6512  switch (inAxis)
6513  {
6514  case Axis::NONE:
6515  {
6516  if (Utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 0.0))
6517  {
6518  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
6519  return std::move(returnArray);
6520  }
6521  else if (Utils::essentiallyEqual(inPercentile, 100.0))
6522  {
6523  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
6524  return std::move(returnArray);
6525  }
6526 
6527  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6528  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6529 
6530  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6531  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6532 
6533  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6534  {
6535  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6536  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6537  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6538 
6539  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6540  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6541  return std::move(returnArray);
6542  }
6543  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6544  {
6545  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6546  return std::move(returnArray);
6547  }
6548  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6549  {
6550  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6551  return std::move(returnArray);
6552  }
6553  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6554  {
6555  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6556  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6557  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6558  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6559  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6560 
6561  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6562  {
6563  case 0:
6564  {
6565  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6566  return std::move(returnArray);
6567  }
6568  case 1:
6569  {
6570  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6571  return std::move(returnArray);
6572  }
6573  }
6574  }
6575  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6576  {
6577  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6578  return std::move(returnArray);
6579  }
6580  }
6581  case Axis::COL:
6582  {
6583  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6584 
6585  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6586  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6587  {
6588  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6589  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6590  }
6591 
6592  return std::move(returnArray);
6593  }
6594  case Axis::ROW:
6595  {
6596  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6597  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6598 
6599  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6600  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6601  {
6602  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6603  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6604  }
6605 
6606  return std::move(returnArray);
6607  }
6608  default:
6609  {
6610  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6611  // of the compiler warning.
6612  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6613  }
6614  }
6615  }
6616

7167  //============================================================================
7168  // Method Description:
7180  template<typename dtype>
7181  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
7182  {
7183  switch (inAxis)
7184  {
7185  case Axis::NONE:
7186  {
7187  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
7188  if (inShift > 0)
7189  {
7190  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
7191  }
7192 
7193  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7194  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
7195 
7196  return std::move(returnArray);
7197  }
7198  case Axis::COL:
7199  {
7200  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7201 
7202  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
7203  if (inShift > 0)
7204  {
7205  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
7206  }
7207 
7208  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7209  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7210  {
7211  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7212  }
7213 
7214  return std::move(returnArray);
7215  }
7216  case Axis::ROW:
7217  {
7218  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7219 
7220  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
7221  if (inShift > 0)
7222  {
7223  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
7224  }
7225 
7226  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
7227  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
7228  {
7229  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7230  }
7231 
7232  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
7233  }
7234  default:
7235  {
7236  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7237  // of the compiler warning.
7238  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7239  }
7240  }
7241  }
7242 
7243  //============================================================================
7244  // Method Description:
7255  template<typename dtype>
7256  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
7257  {
7258  inK %= 4;
7259  switch (inK)
7260  {
7261  case 1:
7262  {
7263  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
7264  }
7265  case 2:
7266  {
7267  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
7268  }
7269  case 3:
7270  {
7271  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
7272  }
7273  default:
7274  {
7275  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7276  // of the compiler warning.
7277  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7278  }
7279  }
7280  }

7315  //============================================================================
7316  // Method Description:
7325  template<typename dtype>
7326  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
7327  {
7328  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
7329  Shape finalShape;
7330  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
7331  {
7332  if (finalShape.isnull())
7333  {
7334  finalShape = ndarray.shape();
7335  }
7336  else if (ndarray.shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
7337  {
7338  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
7339  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7340  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7341  }
7342  else
7343  {
7344  finalShape.rows += ndarray.shape().rows;
7345  }
7346  }
7347 
7348  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
7349  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
7350  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7351  for (auto& ndarray : inArrayList)
7352  {
7353  Shape theShape = ndarray.shape();
7354  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
7355  {
7356  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
7357  {
7358  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = ndarray(row, col);
7359  }
7360  }
7361  rowStart += theShape.rows;
7362  }
7363 
7364  return std::move(returnArray);
7365  }

7368  // Method Description:
7380  template<typename dtype>
7381  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7382  {
7383  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
7384  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7385  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7386 
7387  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
7388  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7389  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7390  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
7391  }

7703  template<typename dtype>

7994  //============================================================================
7995  // Method Description:
8007  template<typename dtype>
8008  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
8009  {
8010  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
8011  switch (inAxis)
8012  {
8013  case Axis::COL:
8014  {
8015  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
8016  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
8017  {
8018  double sum = 0;
8019  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8020  {
8021  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8022  static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
8023  }
8024 
8025  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
8026  }
8027 
8028  return std::move(returnArray);
8029  }
8030  case Axis::ROW:
8031  {
8032  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
8033  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
8034  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8035  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8036  {
8037  double sum = 0;
8038  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8039  {
8040  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8041  static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
8042  }
8043 
8044  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
8045  }
8046 
8047  return std::move(returnArray);
8048  }
8049  case Axis::NONE:
8050  {
8051  double sum = 0.0;
8052  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
8053  {
8054  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
8055  }
8056 
8057  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
8058  return std::move(returnArray);
8059  }
8060  default:
8061  {
8062  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8063  // of the compiler warning.
8064  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
8065  }
8066  }
8067  }
8068 
8069  //============================================================================
8070  // Method Description:
8082  template<typename dtype>
8083  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
8084  {
8085  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
8086  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
8087 
8088  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
8089  {
8090  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
8091  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8092  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8093  }
8094 
8095  switch (inAxis)
8096  {
8097  case Axis::COL:
8098  {
8099  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
8100  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
8101  {
8102  double sum = 0;
8103  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
8104  {
8105  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
8106  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8107  static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
8108  }
8109 
8110  returnArray[row] = sum;
8111  }
8112 
8113  return std::move(returnArray);
8114  }
8115  case Axis::ROW:
8116  {
8117  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
8118  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
8119  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
8120  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8121  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8122  {
8123  double sum = 0;
8124  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8125  {
8126  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
8127  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 +
8128  static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
8129  }
8130 
8131  returnArray[row] = sum;
8132  }
8133 
8134  return std::move(returnArray);
8135  }
8136  case Axis::NONE:
8137  {
8138  double sum = 0.0;
8139  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
8140  {
8141  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
8142  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
8143  }
8144 
8145  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
8146  return std::move(returnArray);
8147  }
8148  default:
8149  {
8150  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8151  // of the compiler warning.
8152  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
8153  }
8154  }
8155  }

8157  //============================================================================
8158  // Method Description:
8170  template<typename dtype>
8171  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
8172  {
8173  uint32 rowStart = 0;
8174  uint32 colStart = 0;
8175  if (inOffset > 0)
8176  {
8177  colStart = inOffset;
8178  }
8179  else
8180  {
8181  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
8182  }
8183 
8184  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
8185  returnArray.zeros();
8186  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
8187  {
8188  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
8189  {
8190  if (col == inN)
8191  {
8192  break;
8193  }
8194 
8195  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
8196  }
8197  }
8198 
8199  return std::move(returnArray);
8200  }

8308  NdArray<dtype> triu(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inOffset)

8311  inOffset -= 1;

8314  uint32 colStart = 0;
8315  if (inOffset > 0)
8316  {
8317  colStart = inOffset;

8320  {
8321  rowStart = inOffset * -1;

8323 
8324  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN, inM);
8325  returnArray.ones();
8326  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
8327  {
8328  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
8329  {
8330  if (col == inM)
8331  {
8332  break;
8333  }
8334 
8335  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(0);
8336  }
8337  }

8368  //============================================================================
8369  // Method Description:
8380  template<typename dtype>
8381  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
8382  {
8383  if (inTrim == "f")
8384  {
8385  uint32 place = 0;
8386  for (auto value : inArray)
8387  {
8388  if (value != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8389  {
8390  break;
8391  }
8392  else
8393  {
8394  ++place;
8395  }
8396  }
8397 
8398  if (place == inArray.size())
8399  {
8400  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8401  }
8402 
8403  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8404  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8405 
8406  return std::move(returnArray);
8407  }
8408  else if (inTrim == "b")
8409  {
8410  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8411  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8412  {
8413  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8414  {
8415  break;
8416  }
8417  else
8418  {
8419  --place;
8420  }
8421  }
8422 
8423  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8424  {
8425  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8426  }
8427 
8428  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8429  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8430 
8431  return std::move(returnArray);
8432  }
8433  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8434  {
8435  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8436  for (auto value : inArray)
8437  {
8438  if (value != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8439  {
8440  break;
8441  }
8442  else
8443  {
8444  ++placeBegin;
8445  }
8446  }
8447 
8448  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8449  {
8450  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8451  }
8452 
8453  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8454  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8455  {
8456  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8457  {
8458  break;
8459  }
8460  else
8461  {
8462  --placeEnd;
8463  }
8464  }
8465 
8466  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8467  {
8468  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8469  }
8470 
8471  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8472  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8473 
8474  return std::move(returnArray);
8475  }
8476  else
8477  {
8478  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8479  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8480  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8481  }
8482  }

8576  // Method Description:
8587  template<typename dtype>
8588  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8589  {
8590  if (inValue < 0)
8591  {
8592  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8593  }
8594  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8595  {
8596  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8597  }
8598  else
8599  {
8600  return inValue;
8601  }
8602  }

8662  //============================================================================
8663  // Method Description:
8675  template<typename dtype>
8676  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8677  {
8678  auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8679  auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8680  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8681  {
8682  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8683  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8684  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8685  }
8686 
8687  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8688  {
8689  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8690  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8691  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8692  }
8693 
8694  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8695 
8696  uint32 idx = 0;
8697  for (auto maskValue : inMask)
8698  {
8699  if (maskValue)
8700  {
8701  outArray[idx] = inA[idx];
8702  }
8703  else
8704  {
8705  outArray[idx] = inB[idx];
8706  }
8707  ++idx;
8708  }
8709 
8710  return std::move(outArray);
8711  }
